holidays.name: International Coffee Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate coffee lovers worldwide and honor the journey of coffee from bean to cup.
holidays.origin: Created by the International Coffee Organization in 2015 to promote fair trade coffee and raise awareness about coffee growers.
holidays.funFact: Over 2 billion cups of coffee are consumed every day globally! This day is perfect for trying a quirky new coffee brew.

holidays.name: World Vegetarian Day
holidays.description: An observance to promote the benefits of vegetarianism for humans, animals, and the environment.
holidays.origin: Established by the North American Vegetarian Society in 1977 and recognized internationally by the International Vegetarian Union.
holidays.funFact: October is Vegetarian Awareness Month, so this day kicks off a whole month of veggie-friendly celebrations!

holidays.name: National Homemade Cookies Day (USA)
holidays.description: A sweet holiday dedicated to baking and enjoying homemade cookies fresh from your oven.
holidays.origin: Popularized by food bloggers and baking enthusiasts to encourage home bakers.
